Watch filter and \"Check all boards\" combination warning

"Selecting "Check all boards" means that if you add more boards in the future, the filter will automatically be applied to those boards as well. 

Sometimes this is a desired behavior (like when creating filters to hide/remove/highlight posts you will probably want those filters to automatically work on all boards you may or may not add in the future, so that you don't have to update filters every time you add new boards). On the other hand, this is very bad when combined with "watch" filters because, due to how they work, we have to execute a separate network request for each board (to download board's current thread list) which consumes battery and network traffic. So if you add 100 boards afterwards, then 100 requests will be executed on every filter watches update cycle. 

Be very careful when using the combination of watch filters together with "check all boards". I decided to allow this combination to work because it may be useful in some rare cases. This warning will be shown every time you create a watch filter so you don't forget about it.
Filter type (%1$s) is not allowed in combination with watch filter action. Only COMMENT and/or SUBJECT types are allowed!
Identical filter already exists. Existing filter index=%1$d
Filter watch filter was successfully created but filter watcher is disabled so nothing is going to happen. You need to enable filter watcher in the settings

Filters act on a given pattern and a place to search the pattern.
If the pattern matches, then the post can be hidden, removed, highlighted, or automatically bookmarked.

These filters are pattern based, and have three modes:

1. The pattern foo bar will match text that has any of the words in it. It will match foo or bar, but not foobar. Placing a * allows any character to be filled in: f*o will match both foo and foooo, but not foobar

2. Quoting your pattern with \" (like \"foo bar\") will match the text exactly. foo bar will match, but foo will not.

3. Regular expressions. /^>implying/ for example. You can use /^>ImPlYiNg/i to make the regex case insensitive.


Note that for country code filtering, troll country codes should be prepended with "t_". In addition, a country code filter automatically implies the case insensitive flag for regex.

You can use Regex101 for more comprehensive explanations of your regular expressions, or as a playground for figuring out an expression. Use Javascript to test.

Actions do the following:
Hide: Replace the post with a stub. You can tap it to un-hide it.
Highlight: A colored bar of your choosing will appear on the left hand side of this post.
Remove: Remove this post. It won\'t be visible at all.
Watch: If you have the thread watcher enabled and background watching on, catalogs will be periodically checked based on your interval setting and any OP that matches the filter will be put into your bookmarks. Any catalogs loaded by the you navigating to them from the board select popup will also be checked.

Enabled filters have priority from top to bottom. Filter precedence for actions is as follows:
1) Capcode or sticky
2) OP
3) Saved replies (your posts)
4) Tripcode
5) Name
6) Comment
7) ID
8) Subject
9) Country Code
10) Filename"

Thread/Filter watcher settings can be found here.

These settings may be in an unstable state. They are for testing. They may break the app and you may have to reset the app data. Use them at your own risk if you are really interested in some feature. Backup everything beforehand.
To watch bookmarks for new posts, turn the thread watcher on.
Watch bookmarks when app is in the foreground
Watch bookmarks when app is either in foreground or background
The interval between updates when the app is in the background
The interval between updates when the app is in the foreground
Use adaptive interval for foreground watcher

When turned on additional %1$d seconds will be added to foreground update interval for every 10 active bookmarks you have meaning the more active bookmarks you have the less often the bookmark updates will become (which is good for battery)
%1$s (Option for testing. You are not supposed to see this)
%1$s (Terrible for battery. Don\'t tell me I didn\'t warn you!)

Regarding background limitation of certain phone models…

It appears that your phone model is one of the models with known problems related to app background execution limitations. If you ever notice that you have no notifications (even though they are supposed to be) when the app is in background, then check this link out for possible solutions:\n\n%1$s"
Automatically bookmark threads that match regex patterns. Enabling this setting will make the watcher work in both foreground/background due to huge update intervals.

By enabling this setting, the app will start collecting crash logs. They are NOT uploaded automatically. Crash logs only collect the stacktrace itself, app version and basic OS information. You can review and upload them manually (or delete) by clicking the \"Report\" setting.

Same as with crashlogs. When enabling this setting ANRs will be collected but not uploaded. ANR means Application Not Responding reports. They will be formed every time the app hangs for more than 2.5 seconds. At that time a thread stack dump will be collected and stored into a file. This may help developers to fix those hangs/freezes/deadlocks so please report them. You can review and upload them manually (or delete) by clicking the \"Report\" setting.

Fetch the file size for inlined files

A HEAD request will be sent for inlined files to try to get the Content-Length header which value will be used as the file size.

⚠⚠⚠ WARNING ⚠⚠⚠

By enabling this setting you may accidentally leak your IP address to IP logger site. Only enable this if you don't care about leaking your IP address.
Default state for image transparency in the viewer
Allow screens to be swiped away

This setting enables the following gestures: 
1. Longtap bottom navigation view + swipe up to open Reply Layout. 
2. Swipe up Reply Layout to expand it. 
3. Swipe down expanded Reply Layout to collapse it or if it is already collapsed to close it. 

Basically allows you to control Reply Layout with only gestures (You can even hide the reply button completely). Some gestures (Longtap + swipe up) do not work with SPLIT layout.
Captcha settings are per-site configurable. Tap for site setup.
By inputting your desktop browser captcha cookies, captcha solving may become easier
Restore last opened board upon app start

When turned on, upon app start the last visited board will be automatically opened (New KurobaEx behavior). Turning this option off will cause loading the first board from the board selection list (Default Clover/Kuroba behavior)
Restore last opened thread upon app start

When turned on, upon app start the last visited thread will be automatically opened (New KurobaEx behavior). When turned off no thread will be automatically opened upon app start (Default Clover/Kuroba behavior)
Tap the post number to reply
Adds a left-side label for every yet unseen post. Only shows unseen posts in threads.
Show copy apk dialog when downloading an update
Every time you download a new update a dialog with suggestion to copy that apk to some other directory will be shown

"Permission to access storage is required for browsing files.
Re-enable this permission in the app settings if you permanently disabled it."

The maximum size of all files stored in the cache before it gets cleaned up. Disk cache is used to reduce the amount of network requests to show media. It\'s also helpful when you have no internet connection or if a media was deleted from the server (you will be able to see it until it\' remove from the cache).
The same as above but it\'s only used when media prefetching setting is turned on. Since you are basically downloading media files and you hover over them you will need a more spacious cache.
Percent of cached files to remove upon cleanup

Percent of cached files that will be removed from the disk upon cache clean up. The higher this setting the more files will be removed at a time which may result in app having delays when viewing media (Because all access to the cache is blocked when clean up procedure is running). The media cache size setting may also affect this. On the other hand the clean up procedure will be executed with higher intervals.
Max posts count in the database

All posts are stored in the database (so you can access threads even without internet connection). This setting regulates the maximum amount of posts in the database before we start running periodic cleanup routines. Posts in bookmarked threads/Original Posts are ignored by cleanup routines.
Max threads count in the database

Same as above. One \"thread\" in database means the original post plus some other thread information. When a thread is deleted from the database, all the information associated with it is deleted as well (like all posts associated with that thread).
Percent of posts/threads to remove upon cleanup

Percent of posts/threads that will be removed from the database upon database cleanup. The higher this setting the more posts/threads will be removed at a time which may result in app taking more time to start up (Because all access to posts/threads database tables is blocked when clean up procedure is running). The max posts/threads in the database setting may also affect this. On the other hand the clean up procedure will be executed with higher intervals.
If a video has audio, mute it by default
Mute the video even if a wired headset is connected
Play videos in an external media player app
Attempt to stream videos, instead of downloading them completely. (Works really bad with 4chan servers)
Save location was moved to a different place. You need to either long click any thumbnail and then click "Download image (Show options)" or long click the \"download\" icon in image viewer.
Loads all images or videos in a thread immediately. Uses it\'s own setting for the cache size which is greater than the regular cache size.
Current timestamp in milliseconds will be used as the name of any picked file

Dump active thread stack traces to log
Makes the app think it\'s updated to the latest version. This will be reset the next time you manually check for updates
Makes the app think it\'s NOT updated to the latest version. This will be reset the next time you manually check for updates
Toggles light/dark theme with a slight delay (5 seconds) ad infinitum (Or until app restart). Is used for dynamic themes testing. \n\nCurrent status: %1$s
Split file downloads into chunks and download them concurrently, when possible; makes loading times shorter when viewing them in the gallery. Determines the number of chunks to split files into.

Adjust zones where Android 10 gestures will be disabled. 

You will have to rotate your phone/tablet to set zones for different orientations. 
You will have to restart the app for the changes to be applied!
All exclusion zones will be deleted; the app will be restarted
Allow OkHttp to use HTTP/2 protocol
Disabling this setting may resolve issues with images not loading whatsoever in some rare cases. Try disabling this setting if images refuse to start loading.

This option will be forcing Cloudflare to preload all currently visible images in a thread. No images will be downloaded on your phone and no additional traffic will be used. Only HEAD requests will be sent for every image in the thread which will force Cloudflare to cache those images. This SHOULD make subsequent image downloads way faster because you will be loading them from Cloudflare servers, not 4chan\'s. This feature works similar to how media prefetching works (you don\'t need to click anything, just scroll through the thread like you always do).
Export application database and other files that are used to persist application state into a zip file.
Restore application state from backup file. This is only supposed to work on the same application version or higher (downgrades are not supported).

Import Bookmarks/Filters/Filters/Hidden posts and threads/Added sites and boards and some other stuff from Kuroba (the settings file must be exported on 4.13.X-release version of Kuroba, other versions probably won\'t work). Settings are not imported since they differ too much. You need to clear the app data beforehand.

" Forgot your 4chan Pass login details?
Go here to reset your PIN.

Don't have a 4chan Pass?
Tap here to learn more. "
Site %1$s is not active. It\'s either completely disabled or you need to activate it first
Archive is disabled because something doesn\'t work as expected. Maybe it will be enabled some time in the future

All these archives are used to retrieve deleted posts/images in a thread.
All archives are disabled by default, you need to enable them manually.
Most of the time you want to enable all of the archives. If one archive is unavailable for some reason, the other one may be used instead (only if they both support the same board).

When fetching posts from an archive, if there was an error (for example an archive was unavailable) the error is stored so that it can be used to calculate a score. The score is used to determine what archive to use when multiple enabled archives support the same board.

Results of the last 5 last fetches are stored and used for the score calculation, which means that if all 5 fetches succeeded then the archive will have the highest score. Such archives are marked with "WORKING" status. If there was at least one error over the last 5 fetches then such archive is marked with "EXPERIENCING PROBLEMS" error. If all 5 fetches resulted in an error then such archive will be marked as "NOT WORKING". Most of the scores are used mostly for notifying the user of what\'s going on. Only the "NOT WORKING" score will disable an archive until all the previous fetch results are not valid anymore (this takes like 30 minutes).

When determining what archive to use we go down from an archive with the highest score to the lowest. If an archive with the highest score does not support files for the board and the next archive supports them then the next archive will be used (since archives that supports files have higher priority). The score resets every 30 minutes for all archives.

You can also manually delete fetch results to change the score so that an archive can be used again if you don\'t want to wait until it\'s done automatically.

If one of the archives for some reason does not load at all (blocked by an ISP) you can just disable it so we don\'t use it\'s score to figure out what archive to use (because requests for blocked sites will just end up in failures with huge timeouts).
No archives are enabled for the current thread. You can enable them in the site settings.
Error while trying get archive descriptor by thread descriptor

No archives were found for the current thread. This means that all archives supporting current board are disabled (In this case you can enable them in site settings) or all archives supporting current board are not working (See archives settings in site settings)

Use new captcha window for no-js captcha

When enabled, a GET request to google.com will be executed to get a cookie, which will be used for captcha authentication. The hardcoded ones sometimes will make you re-enter the captcha dozens of times. Those cookies will be updated automatically (every three months). You may update them manually if you want.
You have to select at least one image (if you see a captcha that does not have any matching images, then it is probably a bug; fill an issue and use the old captcha)

On Android 10 (and above) you may want to enable "Ignore system Day/Night mode" setting. Otherwise the app theme will be based on your system Day/Night mode which may seem as an unexpected behavior.

If a site is hosted by CloudFlare and has anti-ddos checks enabled the application will automatically try to pass them and store CloudFlare clearance cookie that will be used to access site normally without having to pass checks every singe time. You will see a cookie here and will be able to edit/remove it if you ever need to do that. When removing a cookie (making it empty) a new cookie will be requested on the next site access. If a site does not use CloudFlare then this setting will always be empty.

The app will be restarted when exiting the settings screen
